name: Apex City Quay Hotel & Spa

reviews.title: Let down by service
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night in an Executive Double.

reviews.title: Avoid like the plaque unless you enjoy food poisoning and negligent staff
reviews.text: Room was nice, modern, spacious and clean with good sea views. About what you would expect from a 4 star hotel.

reviews.title: Very good
reviews.text: Above average hotel. Simple clean and stylish rooms with space light and decent products. Good view (good use of windows and wood). Lovely pool and hot tubs - well worth checking out. Bar a bit pricey but decent. Food not at all bad. Wireless internet available in rooms at a cost (£15) and a pc is available in the reception for free. (business rooms gone). Overall I would recommend this hotel. Worth shopping around on rates though as prices vary enormously.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed her for a short weekend break hotel was good although public area small, leisure facilities excelent pool, 2 jacuzzies 2 saunas. breakfast OK. In marina area next to hotel GREAT buffet chinese, so much choice and great value.

reviews.title: Perfectly decent hotel
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Apex a number of times (decent, modern hotels are sadly lacking in Dundee) and must say I am surprised at the comments listed here.

All in all I would say it is a 4 star hotel - the rooms are nice and big and only a couple of years old so decorated in a contemporary style - even the bathrooms are lovely. The pool area is also very nice.
reviews.title: Christmas shopping weekend

reviews.text: I usually find the check in staff very helpful.
reviews.title: Eat Elsewhere!

reviews.text: We had a short weekend break at the Apex & can only say we had a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Much better than some of the reviews

reviews.text: Having read some of the reviews our first choice was the Hilton but due to availability we went for the Apex. The exterior isn't that appealing but has a Scandinavian look. Once inside you have a modern well lit lobby, bar & restaurant area. Rooms area a good size, well furnished & the bonus is the DVD player, keeps the kids happy. Plenty of towels & toiletries. All hotels should take note, have a fridge in the room, your clients will thank you.
reviews.title: Awesome Apex

reviews.text: The food is a good standard with a fairly wide choice, breakfast is particularly good. Prices are moderate for food & drinks.
reviews.title: Overrates itself

reviews.text: As for the staff, we found them nothing other than friendly, they couldn't do enough for us. This is contrary to some of the reviews I read, it my be down to the way the staff were spoken to.
reviews.title: Well, if it's good enough for Scotland's political A-listers...

reviews.text: The pool area is good & clean but not that big. They need to change the hours of use for children (not before 9am) as it's the kids who are up first at weekends & are looking for something to do. There is a leisure Centre close by with flumes but we didn't have time to try it out
reviews.title: Great service - great rooms

aka: Apex City Quay Hotel And Spa
